result.execSummary:
The defendant Carly M. GERARDEN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carly M. GERARDEN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The State moves to amend to count 1 county ordinance disorderly conduct, contrary to Manitowoc County Ordinance 6.19.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes a $50.00 forfeiture plus costs, total of $267.50, to be paid by 09-14-15 or 5 days county jail for failure to pay.
Reminder notice mailed to defendant.
Payment Plan requested for monthly payment of $25.00; payment plan documents filed with case.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-10-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 10-09-15 at 3:00 p.m.  Bail is set at $350.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no assaultive contact with Larry and Amanda Born.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Larry and Amanda Born, on 05-07-15.
Initial appearance is set for 06-22-15 at 1:30 p.m.
